data.name: Dark Marowak
rules: This Pokémon is both Fighting Darkness type.

attacks.name: Brick Smash
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hard Bone
attacks.text: Discard a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card from your hand or this attack does nothing.

data.name: Marowak δ
rules: This Pokémon is both Fighting Metal type.

attacks.name: Energy Bone
attacks.text: Choose a number of your opponent's Pokémon up to the amount of Energy attached to Marowak. This attack does 20 damage to each of them.

attacks.name: Metal Crusher
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Metal Pokémon, this attack's base damage is 90.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Vengeance
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Basic Pokémon and each Evolution card in your discard pile. You can't add more than 60 damage in this way.

data.name: Alolan Marowak

attacks.name: Limbo Limbo
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Alolan Club
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokémon in play that has Alolan in its name.

data.flavorText: Its custom is to mourn its lost companions. Mounds of dirt by the side of the road mark the graves of the Marowak.

data.name: Alolan Marowak

attacks.name: Dance of Flames
attacks.text: For each Energy attached to your opponent's Pokémon, attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Burning Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads. If either of them is heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: The bones it possesses were once its mother's. Its mother's regrets have become like a vengeful spirit protecting this Pokémon.

data.name: Marowak

abilities.name: Bodyguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks done to you or your hand by your opponent's Pokémon. Remove any existing effects.

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.

data.name: Marowak

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Bone Impact
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 damage plus 60 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.

data.flavorText: It has been seen pounding boulders with the bone it carries in order to tap out messages to others.

data.name: Marowak

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Call for Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fighting Basic Pokémon card and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

data.flavorText: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to K.O. targets.

data.name: Marowak

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Call for Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fighting Basic Pokémon card and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

data.flavorText: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to K.O. targets.

data.name: Alolan Marowak

attacks.name: Limbo Limbo
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Alolan Club
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokémon in play that has Alolan in its name.

data.flavorText: Its custom is to mourn its lost companions. Mounds of dirt by the side of the road mark the graves of the Marowak.

data.name: Marowak

attacks.name: Bone Lock
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Vortex Chop
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Resistance, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: From its birth, this savage Pokémon constantly holds bones. It is skilled in using them as weapons.

data.name: Marowak

attacks.name: Heavy Bone
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Marowak can't use Heavy Bone during your next turn.

attacks.name: Bone Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: From its birth, this savage Pokémon constantly holds bones. It is skilled in using them as weapons.

data.name: Alolan Marowak

attacks.name: Spirit Smash
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck. If the card you discarded is a Pokémon, this attack does damage equal to that Pokémon's HP to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The rich greenery of the Alola region is hard on Marowak. It controls fire to stay alive.

attacks.name: Triple Bone
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Bone Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Marowak

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Bone Windmill
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.

data.name: Marowak BREAK
rules: BREAK Evolution Rule: Marowak BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Bone Revenge
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

data.name: Marowak

attacks.name: Bone Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Assault Boom
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.flavorText: It throws bones at Mandibuzz to knock it down. It's thought that Marowak is trying to avenge its parent.

data.name: Alolan Marowak-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Cursed Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Fiery Bone
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Lost Boomerang-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. If a Pokémon is Knocked Out by this damage, put that Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone instead of the discard pile. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Marowak

abilities.name: Battle Armor
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 90 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: They thump their bones rhythmically to communicate among themselves. There are nearly 50 different rhythmic patterns.

data.name: Marowak

attacks.name: Bone Throw
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Boundless Power
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.flavorText: When this Pokémon evolved, the skull of its mother fused to it. Marowak's temperament also turned vicious at the same time.

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon do 40 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Bone Vengeance
attacks.text: If any of your Benched Cubone have any damage counters on them, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.name: Alolan Marowak

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon sets the bone it holds on fire and dances through the night as a way to mourn its fallen allies.
